oai_dc:dc.dc:title: Oral history interview with David K. Wilson, 2006 September 13, excerpt 04
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: An excerpt from an oral history interview with Nashville business and civic leader David Kirkpatrick "Pat" Wilson, conducted on 13 September 2006 by Cabot Pyle and Kenneth L. Roberts as part of the Nashville Public Library's Nashville Business Leaders Oral History Project: The Turner Interviews. Wilson discusses the business climate in Nashville during the 1940s and how business leaders of the time, particularly those in the insurance industry, were active in their own areas but were not particularly active in the community. The complete interview, as well as an index, is available in the repository.
